etymology.description: 枕 (pillow; to rest the head) + 头 (noun suffix ‘head/thing’) = pillow
etymology.interpretation: Combines the base noun 枕 with the high‑frequency suffix 头 to denote a concrete object for resting the head. In speech 头 is often neutral tone here (zhěntou), highlighting its suffix function.
etymology.simplification: 頭 was simplified to 头 to reduce strokes for a very common suffix; 枕 is unchanged.

parts.english: pillow; to rest the head on; cushion; bolster

examples.chinese: 我喜欢软一点的枕头(我喜歡軟一點的枕頭)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan ruǎn yìdiǎn de zhěntou.
examples.english: I like pillows that are a bit softer.

examples.chinese: 旅行时我会带上自己的枕头(旅行時我會帶上自己的枕頭)。
examples.pinyin: Lǚxíng shí wǒ huì dài shang zìjǐ de zhěntou.
examples.english: When traveling, I bring my own pillow.

examples.chinese: 枕头太高会让脖子不舒服(枕頭太高會讓脖子不舒服)。
examples.pinyin: Zhěntou tài gāo huì ràng bózi bù shūfu.
examples.english: A pillow that’s too high can make your neck uncomfortable.
